channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-29852] Adaptive Scheduler duplicates operators for each parallel instance in the Web UI
item.description: All the operators in the DAG are shown repeatedly
item.summary: Adaptive Scheduler duplicates operators for each parallel instance in the Web UI

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Hi JasonLee thanks for reporting the issue! Could this phenomenon be reproduced? And if possible could you provide the content of the response from the web server via http://<ip>:<port>/jobs/<job_id> ?

Hi gaoyunhaii  yes,Stably repeated, I tested two different SQL jobs and one datastream api job,There will be repetition.

// the content of the response from the web server

Hi JasonLee , I can't reproduce this problem with flink-1.16 WordCount, can you show how to reproduce this?

Hi huwh , I just used the command on the website like the following:

./flink run-application -t yarn-application ../examples/streaming/TopSpeedWindowing.jar
./flink run -t yarn-per-job --detached ../examples/streaming/TopSpeedWindowing.jar

They all repeat as in the picture above.

I can't reproduce this with this jar.{}

 

My Flink version is 

Version: 1.16.0 Commit: af6eff8 @ 2022-10-20T04:21:45+02:00

Hi huwh That's a little weird,I submit the task with the following command:

./flink run-application -t yarn-application ../examples/streaming/TopSpeedWindowing.jar

The DAG is shown below,The window and sink operators have 4 parallelism, shown four times below

hi all, I re-downloaded and deployed the Flink cluster, the flink job is normal, and there is no duplication of operator. I do not know what the problem is, in a word, it is OK now, so I will close this issue, thanks.

Hi, JasonLee I found this is a bug while adaptiveScheduler update the ExecutionGraph#JsonPlan. It put all the execution vertices into the jsonPlan. Could you reopen this tickets, I would like to fix it. cc dwysakowicz
huwh yeah,Thank you for your reply,I've already open it.

We are facing this issue in 1.16.1 and need to make a go/no-go decision and wondering whether this problem is just affecting the endpoint /jobs/{jobId} (and so the UI) or does it have deeper implications?
This is just a problem with the REST API representation, there are no broader consequences
